page.title: 04LAND TYPES
page.content: {Land type}within the area comprises {Grade one land}-land with almost no limitations to agricultural use, grows most crops including horticultural crops. {Grade two land}-land with some minor limitations but capable of growing a wide variety of crops. {Field size}has increased during the last 30 years with the loss of hedgerows and trees. These changes are the result of economic forces, higher output, higher costs and economies achieved by modern technology, especially large scale mechanisation. {Increased farm efficiency}-yields of winter wheat have risen by 136% between 1945-1983 due to improved husbandry and varieties. Average yield per hectare was 2.66 tonnes in 1945-1950 but rose to 6.29 tonnes per hectare by 1979-1981.
